revised_title: Catalysis of Chloral Decomposition by Iodine
tldr: The authors studied the decomposition of chloral and found that it is catalyzed by iodine. They discovered that the catalyzed reaction occurs at a lower temperature than the uncatalyzed decomposition. The authors also found that iodine catalyzes the decomposition of chloroform to a similar extent. The reaction is a homogeneous gaseous process, and the authors determined the order of the reaction and the activation energy.
